name: Vegan Tuna Sandwich
description: These fish free sandwiches are made from mashed chickpeas, which create a flaked consistency somewhat similar to tuna. Vegan tuna is perfect in sandwiches, wraps or on crackers and is ready in 10 minutes or less!
recipeIngredient: (2) 15-ounce cans chickpeas (garbanzo beans), drained and rinsed
3-4 tablespoons Vegan Mayo (| homemade or store bought)
1 tablespoon soy sauce, or tamari for gluten-free
For serving: bread, sliced tomatoes, lettuce, red onion, avocado, mustard

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, mash the chickpeas with a potato masher (or fork) until they are mostly mashed. You can leave a few beans whole if you'd like.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, mash the chickpeas with a potato masher (or fork) until they are mostly mashed. You can leave a few beans whole if you'd like.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the pickles, celery, 3-4 tablespoons of vegan mayo and soy sauce or tamari. Stir well to combine. Cover and place in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes if you can, to let it get cold and let the flavors come together.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the pickles, celery, 3-4 tablespoons of vegan mayo and soy sauce or tamari. Stir well to combine. Cover and place in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes if you can, to let it get cold and let the flavors come together.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve with bread, mustard, lettuce, tomato slices, red onion and avocados if desired. Or serve on a large green salad, or in a wrap, or on crackers.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve with bread, mustard, lettuce, tomato slices, red onion and avocados if desired. Or serve on a large green salad, or in a wrap, or on crackers.
